required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Erlotinib (Tarceva) as a Single Agent or Intercalated With Combination Chemotherapy in Patients With EGFR Positive NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Randomized Study of Tarceva (Erlotinib) as a Single Agent or Intercalated With Combination Chemotherapy in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Who Have Tumors With EGFR Protein Overexpression and/or Increased EGFR Gene Copy Numbers

brief_summary.textblock: This will be the first prospective study where patients will be selected on the basis of two measures of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) pathway. The study will assess prospectively the efficacy of erlotinib as a single agent or intercalated with chemotherapy in highly selected patients with EGFR overexpression and/or EGFR amplification.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who's disease had not progressed at 6 months. Disease progression defined as radiological and/or symptomatic disease progression or death in absence of progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until time of disease progression, as assessed every 21 days (maximum 28.8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Median time until disease progression. Disease progression defined as radiological and/or symptomatic disease progression or death in absence of progression.
Percentage of patients alive after 12 months of study treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study treatment until time of death (maximum 29.0 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Median number of months from first study treatment until time of death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: While receiving study treatment; assessed every 21 days until progression (maximum 28.8 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in size of tumor: Complete Response (CR) = no measurable tumor; Partial Response (PR) = 30% decrease in size of measurable tumor; Stable Disease (SD) = measurable tumor size has not changed; Progressive Disease (PD) = measurable tumor larger than at baseline

secondary_outcome.time_frame: While receiving study treatment; assessed every 21 days until progression (maximum 28.8 months).
secondary_outcome.description: Median length of time that tumor showed any type of response, ie, CR, PR, or SD

arm_group.description: carboplatin AUC 6 on Day 1 to 21 days, paclitaxel 200 mg/m2 on Day 1 to 21 days, erlotinib 150 mg Days 2-15 for 4 cycles then erlotinib 150 mg daily until progression, withdrawal of consent, or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >= 18
- Histologically or cytologically documented non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG)performance status (PS)0, 1, 2
- Radiologically measurable or evaluable disease No prior chemotherapy
- 1 or 2 epithelial growth factor receptor (EGFR) pathway markers positive at screening
- Tumor tissue block or fine needle aspirate
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any concurrent anticancer therapy or radiation
- Other active malignancy
- Uncontrolled brain metastases
- GI abnormalities
- Severe abnormalities of the cornea
- Significant cardiac disease
- Active infection

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first patient was treated 28 March 2006 and the analysis database locked 20 March 2009
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled patients were randomly assigned to 1 of 2 treatment groups.

group.title: Erlotinib + Chemotherapy (Intercalated)
group.description: carboplatin AUC 6 on Day 1-21 days, paclitaxel 200 mg/m^2 on Day 1-21 days, erlotinib 150 mg Days 2-15 for 4 cycles then erlotinib 150 mg daily until progression, withdrawal of consent, or unacceptable toxicity

outcome.title: Best Tumor Response
outcome.description: Change in size of tumor: Complete Response (CR) = no measurable tumor; Partial Response (PR) = 30% decrease in size of measurable tumor; Stable Disease (SD) = measurable tumor size has not changed; Progressive Disease (PD) = measurable tumor larger than at baseline
outcome.time_frame: While receiving study treatment; assessed every 21 days until progression (maximum 28.8 months)
outcome.population: All patients who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had both a baseline and at least one on-treatment tumor assessment

group.title: Erlotinib + Chemotherapy (Intercalated)
group.description: carboplatin AUC 6 on Day 1-21 days, paclitaxel 200 mg/m^2 on Day 1-21 days, erlotinib 150 mg Days 2-15 for 4 cycles then erlotinib 150 mg daily until progression, withdrawal of consent, or unacceptable toxicity

measure.title: Best Tumor Response
measure.description: Change in size of tumor: Complete Response (CR) = no measurable tumor; Partial Response (PR) = 30% decrease in size of measurable tumor; Stable Disease (SD) = measurable tumor size has not changed; Progressive Disease (PD) = measurable tumor larger than at baseline
measure.population: All patients who received at least 1 dose of study drug and who had both a baseline and at least one on-treatment tumor assessment

outcome.title: Duration of Tumor Response
outcome.description: Median length of time that tumor showed any type of response, ie, CR, PR, or SD
outcome.time_frame: While receiving study treatment; assessed every 21 days until progression (maximum 28.8 months).
outcome.population: All patients who had any type of tumor response, ie, CR, PR, or SD

reported_events.time_frame: While on study drug and 30 days after last dose
reported_events.desc: Adverse events are provided regardless of causality; safety population includes patients who received at least one dose of study drug

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
